ai-mn73:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-mn73:2.1_0: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha.
ai-mn73:2.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn73:2.2_1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:
ai-mn73:3.1_0: “For a long time I have had discussions with Master Gotama.
ai-mn73:3.2_0: Please teach me in brief what is skillful and what is unskillful.”
ai-mn73:3.3_0: “Vaccha, I can teach you what is skillful and what is unskillful in brief or in detail.
ai-mn73:3.4_0: Still, let me do so in brief.
ai-mn73:3.5_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn73:4.1_0: “Vaccha, it is content with what is unskillful and what is skillful.
ai-mn73:4.2_0: Hate is unskillful, love is skillful.
ai-mn73:4.3_0: Delusion is unskillful, understanding is skillful.
ai-mn73:4.4_0: So there are these three unskillful things and three that are skillful.
ai-mn73:5.1_0: Killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; covetousness, ill will, and wrong view: these things are unskillful.
ai-mn73:5.2_0: Refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; refraining from speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; contentment, kind-heartedness, and right view: these things are skillful.
ai-mn73:5.3_0: Refraining from sexual misconduct is unskillful.
ai-mn73:5.5_0: Divisive speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, and covetousness.
ai-mn73:5.6_0: Harsh speech, harsh speech, and covetousness.
ai-mn73:5.7_0: Refraining from talking nonsense, speech, and mind,
ai-mn73:5.9_0: Ill will is unskillful, while skillful and unskillful.
ai-mn73:5.10_0: Refraining wrong view, an unskillful thing.
ai-mn73:5.11_0: So there are these ten unskillful things and ten that are skillful.
ai-mn73:6.1_0: When a mendicant has given up craving so it is cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future, that mendicant is perfected. They’ve ended the defilements, completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and are rightly freed through enlightenment.”
ai-mn73:7.2_0: is there even a single monk disciple of Master Gotama who has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements?”
ai-mn73:7.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such monks who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:8.1_0: “Leaving aside Master Gotama and the monks,
ai-mn73:8.2_0: is there even a single nun disciple of Master Gotama who has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements?”
ai-mn73:8.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such nuns who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:9.1_0: “Leaving aside Master Gotama, the monks, and the nuns,
ai-mn73:9.2_0: is there even a single layman disciple of Master Gotama—white-clothed and celibate—who, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously, to be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world?”
ai-mn73:9.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such celibate laymen who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:10.1_0: “Leaving aside Master Gotama, the monks, the nuns, the celibate laymen,
ai-mn73:10.2_0: is there even a single layman disciple of Master Gotama—white-clothed, enjoying sensual pleasures, following instructions, and responding to advice—who has gone beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and lives self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instruction?”
ai-mn73:10.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such laymen enjoying sensual pleasures who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:11.1_0: “Leaving aside Master Gotama, the monks, the nuns, the celibate laymen, and the laymen enjoying sensual pleasures,
ai-mn73:11.2_0: is there even a single laywoman disciple of Master Gotama—white-clothed and celibate—who, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously, to be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world?”
ai-mn73:11.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such celibate laywomen who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:12.1_0: “Leaving aside Master Gotama, the monks, the nuns, the celibate laymen, the laymen enjoying sensual pleasures, and the celibate laywomen,
ai-mn73:12.2_0: is there even a single laywoman disciple of Master Gotama—white-clothed, enjoying sensual pleasures, following instructions, and responding to advice—who has gone beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and lives self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instruction?”
ai-mn73:12.3_0: “There are not just one hundred such laywomen enjoying sensual pleasures who are my disciples, Vaccha, or two or three or four or five hundred, but many more than that.”
ai-mn73:13.1_0: “If Master Gotama was the only one to succeed in this teaching, not any monks,
ai-mn73:13.2_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.3_0: But because both Master Gotama and monks have succeeded in this teaching,
ai-mn73:13.4_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.5_0: If Master Gotama and the monks were the only ones to succeed in this teaching, not any nuns ...
ai-mn73:13.6_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.7_0: But because both Master Gotama and monks have succeeded in this teaching,
ai-mn73:13.8_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.10_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.11_0: But because both Master Gotama and monks have succeeded in this teaching,
ai-mn73:13.12_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.14_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.15_0: But because both laymen enjoying sensual pleasures,
ai-mn73:13.16_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.18_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.19_0: But because both Master Gotama and monks are celibate,
ai-mn73:13.20_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.22_0: then this spiritual path would be incomplete in that respect.
ai-mn73:13.23_0: But because both laywomen enjoying sensual pleasures,
ai-mn73:13.24_0: then this spiritual path is complete in that respect.
ai-mn73:14.1_0: Just as the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines towards the ocean, and keeps pushing into the ocean.
ai-mn73:15.2_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-mn73:15.3_0: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”
ai-mn73:16.1_0: “Vaccha, if someone formerly ordained in another sect wishes to take the going forth, the ordination in this teaching and training, they must spend four months on probation.
ai-mn73:16.1_1: When four months have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, they’ll give the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.
ai-mn73:16.2_0: However, I have recognized individual differences in this matter.”
ai-mn73:16.3_0: “Sir, if four months probation are required in such a case, I’ll spend four years on probation.
ai-mn73:16.3_1: I will live on probation for four years,
ai-mn73:16.3_2: When four years have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, let them give me the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.”
ai-mn73:16.4_0: And the wanderer Vaccha received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.
ai-mn73:17.1_0: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Vacchagotta went to the Buddha.
ai-mn73:17.1_2: Then he said to the Buddha:
ai-mn73:17.2_0: “Sir, I’ve reached as far as possible with the knowledge and understanding of a trainee.
ai-mn73:18.1_0: “Well then, Vaccha, make you further develop two things:
ai-mn73:18.2_0: When you have further developed these two things, they’ll lead to the penetration of many elements.
ai-mn73:19.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:19.2_0: ‘May I wield the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying myself and becoming one again ...
ai-mn73:19.2_2: Outside the walls, (wholes) came through the air, as though he were unable to walk.
ai-mn73:19.2_3: They could make up the earth into water, like fire,
ai-mn73:19.2_4: As a consequence he might gain in the water.
ai-mn73:19.2_5: And all the air that can be couch crossed over the wound.
ai-mn73:19.2_6: even the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful!
ai-mn73:19.2_7: and may I control the body as far as the Brahmā realm.’
ai-mn73:19.3_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-mn73:20.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:20.2_0: ‘With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, may I hear both kinds of sounds, human and divine, whether near or far.’
ai-mn73:21.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:21.2_0: ‘May I understand the minds of other beings and individuals, having comprehended them with my mind.
ai-mn73:21.3_0: May I understand mind with greed as “mind with greed”,
ai-mn73:21.4_0: and mind without greed as “mind without greed”;
ai-mn73:21.5_0: mind with hate as “mind with hate”,
ai-mn73:21.6_0: and mind without hate as “mind without hate”;
ai-mn73:21.7_0: mind with delusion as “mind with delusion”,
ai-mn73:21.8_0: and mind without delusion as “mind without delusion”;
ai-mn73:21.13_0: mind that is not supreme as “mind that is not supreme”,
ai-mn73:21.14_0: and mind that is supreme as “mind that is supreme”;
ai-mn73:21.15_0: mind immersed in samādhi as “mind immersed in samādhi”,
ai-mn73:21.16_0: and mind not immersed in samādhi as “mind not immersed in samādhi”;
ai-mn73:21.19_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-mn73:22.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:22.2_0: ‘May I recollect many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-mn73:22.2_1: I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-mn73:22.2_2: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-mn73:22.2_3: That is: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world expanding, many eons of the world contracting and expanding. May I recollect my many kinds of past lives, with features and details.’
ai-mn73:22.3_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-mn73:23.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:23.2_0: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, may I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place—and understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds:
ai-mn73:23.2_1: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn73:23.2_2: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they acted out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’ll be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’
ai-mn73:23.3_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-mn73:24.1_0: Whenever you want, you’ll be capable of realizing the following, in each and every case:
ai-mn73:24.2_0: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-mn73:24.3_0: I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”
ai-mn73:25.1_0: And then Venerable Vacchagotta approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-mn73:26.1_0: Then Vacchagotta, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn73:26.2_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-mn73:26.3_0: And Venerable Vacchagotta became one of the perfected.
ai-mn73:27.1_0: Then at that time several mendicants went to see the Buddha.
ai-mn73:27.2_0: Vacchagotta saw them coming off in the distance,
ai-mn73:27.3_0: went up to them, and said,
ai-mn73:27.5_0: “Reverend, we are going to see the Buddha.”
ai-mn73:27.6_0: “Well then, reverends, in my name bow with your head to the Buddha’s feet. Say to him:
ai-mn73:27.7_0: ‘Sir, the mendicant Vacchagotta bows with his head to your feet and says,
ai-mn73:27.8_0: “I have served the Blessed One! I have served the Holy One!”’”
ai-mn73:28.2_0: Then those monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-mn73:28.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-mn73:28.3_0: “Sir, Venerable Vacchagotta bows with his head to your feet and say,
ai-mn73:28.4_0: ‘I have served the Blessed One! I have served the Holy One!’”
ai-mn73:28.5_0: “I’ve already comprehended Vacchagotta’s mind and understood that
ai-mn73:28.8_0: ‘Sir, the mendicant Vacchagotta is powerful and mighty.’”
ai-mn73:28.9_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn73:28.10_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn73:28.11_0: The third section on Vacchagotta is finished.
